fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34958].
  {panel}

When you navigate to a project > labels, there are labels shown are various cases: All caps, mixed case, all lower.

However, when you click on them to locate those, the search does not display based on case sensitivity.  So, I clicked on mixed case, the query is correct; but, the results shown don't match the query.  The results are showing all values, regardless of case. 

I need it to show the results for what is being requested. 

Attached is the screenshot that shows the labels of ATLAS, Atlas, and atlas. 

The other attachment shows that I clicked on the label of Atlas and the query is correct; but, the right for one of the issue details shows that it has the label of ATLAS and not Atlas.
fields.summary: Labels in search is not retrieving based on case sensitivity
Plugin Usage Details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34955].
  {panel}

When an attempt is made to use the Notification Helper to debug a "why is JIRA refusing to send email" problem, a modal dialog appears over the page which is larger than the page as per the attached screen.

For reasons unknown scrolling of the screen is disabled, and so it is impossible to reach whatever "ok" or "cancel" buttons that might allow the user to continue.

This renders the Notification Helper less helpful.

*Workaround*
Resize/Maximize the browser window to view the complete content of the dialog.
Put it in fullscreen mode if maximizing doesn't help.
fields.summary: "Notification Helper" UI disables scroll, places OK off screen

fields.description:
Create a new Project using 'Simple Issue Tracking' template.
Now JIRA has created a new workflow scheme for you automatically but the description is set to 'jira.issuetracking.project.workflow.scheme.description'.
fields.summary: Description of workflow scheme created from a new project 'Simple Issue Tracking' template is incorrect

fields.description:
Hi,
I just installed the evaluation of JIRA 6.0.8.x64 on Windows Server 2008 R2.
In the wizard, I selected to link JIRA to my own MS SQL Database on SQL Server 2008. I created the table and connected JIRA to it. Then I created an admin account in the wizard, clicked next. I got on the Dashboard page (the widgets are both displaying an error) and when I try to login with the freshly created admin account I get the error :
"Sorry, your username and password are incorrect - please try again."

I didn't do anything on the database, just followed the wizard and I can't login. I tried to uninstall an install again, but still doesn't work.

When looking at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Retrieving+the+JIRA+Administrator#RetrievingtheJIRAAdministrator-1.Senditviaemail, I looked at the content of the 'cwd_user' table but there is no user account in there. What could be the problem? how can I see a log somewhere to see what could be going wrong? thanks
fields.summary: Cannot log in as Administrator right after Setup Wizard

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce :
# Try to create a issue using a direct url like : http://localhost:8604/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10000&issuetype=1&components=10000&priority=1
# Add attachments to the issue and click Create to submit the form.
# Now try to create another issue by going to the same url : http://localhost:8604/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10000&issuetype=1&components=10000&priority=1
# Notice that the attachments are still there on the page
# The browser caches are still storing the attachments.
fields.summary: Creating issues using direct link remembers the attachments from previous issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34949].
  {panel}

Customers are left without much information when they are unable to display images in issue description or comment.

It would be great if there's a message pointing the customer to what is irking and need to be fixed.

For the issue to be fixed the below workaround has to be applied:
Editing the Configuration Settings that were preventing the attachments from:
* Sniffing Security Hole:  Secure: forced download of attachments for all browsers 
To
* Workaround Policy: Work around Internet Explorer security hole
fields.summary: Providing a meaningful message when unable to display images

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34948].
  {panel}

In JIRA 6.1, it is possible to [rename a project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+a+Project+Key?from=SvEC]. However, the attachment directory still mapped to the old project key directory. (Described [Here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+a+Project+Key#EditingaProjectKey-Notesforchangemanagement])

h4.Current Behavior:
- User renamed a project key from "ABC" to "KLM"
- In $JIRA-HOME/data/attachment directory, the attachment is still located under ABC directory. This somehow created some confusion to browse the attachment manually.

h4.Suggested Behavior:
- Ideally, the attachment directory should be renamed to the new project key ("KLM").
fields.summary: Migrate the attachment data to new directory post renaming project key

fields.description:
When user create a new project using Enter key instead of mouse click on the submit button, it will cause the Project UI freeze in loading screen. 

For example:
!hang_screen.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce the problem:
# Go click on Create Project link in Project menu.
# Select Bug Tracking template and use mouse to click *Next* button.
# Please enter any name and tab to key field (all input using keyboard no mouse to hover to next field).
# After enter *Tab* key to Project Lead field, please type a character/alphabet that contain in user directory. For example:
!project_lead.JPG|thumbnail!
# Then hit Enter key. You will get this behavior: 
!hang_screen.JPG|thumbnail!
Also, the following stack trace:
{noformat}
2013-09-23 15:19:02,450 http-bio-8080-exec-9 ERROR admin 919x70x1 3armqy 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/jira/rest/api/util/ErrorCollection
	at com.atlassian.jira.projecttemplates.rest.ProjectTemplatesResource.createProjectFromFormRequest(ProjectTemplatesResource.java:127)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
...
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.rest.api.util.ErrorCollection
	at org.apache.felix.framework.ModuleImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(ModuleImpl.java:772)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.ModuleImpl.access$200(ModuleImpl.java:73)
	at org.apache.felix.framework.ModuleImpl$ModuleClassLoader.loadClass(ModuleImpl.java:1690)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)
{noformat}

For more details step, please download the *steps.mp4* video.

h3. Finding
* The problem is not reproducible in JIRA 6.0.8.

h3. Workaround
* Please use the mouse to click on the submit button when creating a Project.
fields.summary: Freeze in loading screen when create Project using Enter key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34945].
{panel}
In JIRA 6.x, 7.x, or 8.x, it is possible to [rename a project key|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Editing+a+Project+Key?from=SvEC]. However, it is not possible to reuse a project key that was previously used in Jira.

Even archiving a Project, Jira will still keep the history of already used keys.
h4. Current Behavior:
 * Let's say the user has renamed a project key from "ABC" to "KLM"
 * Although there is no project that uses the project key ABC, the user is *not* allowed to re-use "ABC" for the new project key.

h4. Suggested behavior:
 * Ideally, user should be able to re-use the project key "ABC" for other/new project

h4. Workaround
 * Currently, there is +*no workaround*+ to re-use a project key.

h4. (!) DO NOT use SQL queries to change DB tables to try to re-use keys.

This will lead to database inconsistencies as projects are connected to issues, attachments, permissions, workflows, plugins, custom scripts, and etc..
fields.summary: Provide the ability to reuse the project key from a deleted project

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# As an administrator create around 10 groups for testing purposes
# Ensure 'Comment Visibility' in 'General Configuration' is set to 'Groups & Project Roles'
# Navigate to the Detail View of an issue and click on the 'Viewable by..' drop-down list
# Resize the browser screen so that only a portion of the Groups drop down list are shown (for testing purposes)
# Compare this behaviour with standard View Issue page

h4. Expected results
The Comment Visibility drop-down list in Detail View should be scrollable like Issue View

h4. Actual results
The Comment Visibility drop-down is cut off in detail view and is not scrollable
 
h4. Temporary Workaround
Maximize the browser in the window, and zoom out in browser settings (will vary depending on browser) until the whole list is shown.
Generally to zoom in/out:
Windows - (CTRL +/- )  
Mac: - (CMD & +/- )
fields.summary: Group Drop Down List in Comment Visibility in Detail View is not Scrollable

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create user 'Admin' with display name 'F Bloggs'
# Create project 'Project 1'
# Assign 'Admin' as project lead (role) of 'Project 1'
# Add 'Projects Gadget' to dashboard, leave 'Projects' setting as "All Projects" and confirm 'F Bloggs' is displayed as Lead under 'Project 1'
# Edit 'Admin' user display name to 'Freddy B'

h4. Expected Results
Projects gadget should reflect the name change for the 'Lead' role. 'Freddy B' should be shown.

h4. Actual Results
Project gadget still displays 'F Bloggs' as the 'Lead' role.  Deleting and re-adding does not correct behaviour.  

h4. Workaround
Navigate to 'Project 1' administration, and change the Project Lead role from 'Admin' user to another user, and then change back.  Save changes, and refresh Projects gadget. New username should now be displayed.

Alternative Workaround:
Restarting JIRA also appears to correct this issue
fields.summary: Changing user Display Name does not update Projects Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34927].
  {panel}

I would like to re-open this issue as the current behaviour seems counterintuitive.

If Jira want to support it's use as a ticketting tool, then this is clearly something that would add value to Jira.

In some cases users go to great length to create emails that contain multiple screenshots to document their case. Yet Jira decouples the images from the email content and adds them as attachment.
Since the email handler creates the attachments from the received email (and thus knows the filenames of all created attachments) it can easily insert these filenames in the comment or description it creates from the email.

In this way the issues created through email do not loose their meaning as they sometimes do now.

--- original text from cloned issue ---

Comments left when attaching a file are usually specifically for that attachment.  The way Jira separates the attachment from the comment on the ticket is confusing and many times makes the comment less effective.  I've started to make it a habit to always include a link to the attachment at the beginning of my comment to maintain the connection between the two (using the \[\^attachment.ext\] syntax).

Is there any way to make this a default behavior for all attachment comments?  In other words, make the final comment a concatenation of "attachment link" and "attachment comment".  For example:

{noformat}
[^screenshot.png]

Here's a screenshot of the issue I'm seeing.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Automatically include attachment link in attachment comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When performed in a certain way (the replication steps is below), the menu where new issues are created uses the attachment from the previous created issue.

h3. Steps to replicate 
# Create an issue in a new tab (separate from the dashboard)
# In this new issue, include an attachment
# In the newly created issue, try to create an issue in another new tab
# Scroll down the page, and in the attachments section, the attachment from the previous created issue will already be attached

*P.S.:* _If you disable the Issue Create pop-out as you can see [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+disable+Create+Issue+popup], the same behaviour will occur._

A screencast has been inserted for easier understanding and replication

h3. Workaround

* If the new issue is not created in a new tab (for example, if it is created in a pop-up window that is generated by directly clicking on the 'Create Issue' button), the attachment would not be carried over

h3. Other facts

* This was tested in JIRA 6.0, 6.0.4, and 6.0.8. Only JIRA 6.0.8 seems to be affected among the three
fields.summary: Create issue carries over attachment from previous issue

fields.description:

Username is: user@example.com
Display Name is: Example User

when I mention the user I would expect to see "Example User" as a link to his profile.

What actually happens is, that the following is displayed:
{code}[~user@example.com] {code}
which generates a mailto link instead of a link to the users profile.
fields.summary: Mentions are not displayed correctly when using email adresses as usernames

fields.description:
During CSV import, if the project is available from the saved configuration file, the project selection field have overlapping words rendered, tested with IE 8. See below:

!csvimport.jpg!

*Steps to Replicate*

# Import a random CSV file and save the configuration
# Attempt to import again same/different CSV file but select the saved configuration file
# Note that when you click next, it will return to the above error.

*Workaround*

* Manually edit the configuration file and remove the string below:
{noformat}
 "project.key" : "TEST",
{noformat}

Linux users can use the following command to trim away the string:
{code}
grep -v "project.key" CSV-Configuration.txt > CSV-Configuration-new.txt
{code}
fields.summary: CSV Import Project Selection Rendering Problem on IE8

fields.description: Currently freshly installed JIRA will create Cloners links in correct direction, but instances upgraded from JIRA older than 6.0 can have jira.clone.link.legacy.direction flag set to true and create those links in "legacy" direction. Flag jira.clone.link.legacy.direction can be also switched on and off manually in Advanced Settings. This easily results in broken instances where some links were created in correct and some in "legacy" direction. Existence of this flag also makes life harder for plugin developers.
fields.summary: Warranty - Cloning issues should always create links in correct direction(from clone to original issue)

  {panel}

*Current Behaviour:*
When inserting the 'Pie Chart' macro into a Confluence page and using the same filter, the preview screen does not render.  _Example attached_

The jira logs report:
{noformat}2013-09-16 23:44:39.964113500 2013-09-16 23:44:39,964 TP-Processor16 WARN sysadmin 1424x57799x1 ninlds 59.167.133.100,131.103.27.196 /charts [jira.charts.jfreechart.DisplayChartServlet] File not found, returning 404 (filename='jfreechart-onetime-5137764596391221134.png').{noformat}

*Expected Behaviour:*
The expected behaviour of the JIRA pie-chart macro is available when using the macro as a gadget in the dashboard.  Selecting an available filter displays the related issues.  _Example attached_

The location of the gadget is: https://<instance>/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:pie-chart-gadget/gadgets/piechart-gadget.xml

The same behaviour has also been observed in the 'Created v. Resolved' macro.

Additionally, existing macros that were saved, now have no charts being displayed within the Confluence page, _example attached_

$textUtils.htmlEncode($issueType.name)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34902].
  {panel}

When we transition to Closed, one of the required fields is resolution. 
However, in most all cases, resolution is already populated when it is Resolved - it could be fixed, complete, answered, cannot reproduce,etc. 

However, since it is required, you have to input something and the transition then changes everything in that bulk action to the one selected. 

Consequently, you have to filter out by resolution before doing a bulk transition which is inefficient. 

Either don't make resolution required (and if it's not done, those issues don't complete the transition); or, only override the resolution if one doesn't exist (it is currently unresolved). 

Else the integrity of the data is affected.
fields.summary: Do not override existing resolutions in a bulk transition
Search by createdDate should account for a whole day and not midnight of a specific day
Add memory configuration to JIRA's Config tool

fields.description:
Whilst analyzing Jira Performance with AppDynamics I have seen the following class/method to be slow (with bigger ZIP files):
com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentZipKit.isZip(File f)

Further analysis has shown that his class uses the JDK class ZIPFile and getEntries to figure out if the given File is a ZIPFile.

Please consider just checking the file header (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_%28file_format%29#File_headers) to detect zip files, you would get a ZIPException anyhow it the ZIP is broken or incomplete (and this exception might not be thrown until you iterated over the entries and hit the defect part/EOF).

This would reduce upload speed of zipped attachments to issues.

- Dieter
fields.summary: Performance: Jira-Class com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentZipKit has imperformant implementation

fields.description:
h4. Summary 
Israel has a new timezone setting effective this summer. In order to update the timezone information, user have to run [{{tzupdater.jar}}|http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/documentation/tzupdater-readme-136440.html] against the jre in JIRA installation directory (for JIRA Installer)

The update was completed successfully, but it is not reflected inside JIRA. i.e. the update failed in JIRA operation. 

h4. Steps to reproduce & screenshots
* Change system timezone into (UTC+02:00) Jerusalem [Windows]
* Change JIRA's timezone into (GMT+02:00) Jerusalem in General Configuration and Profile Preferences.
* Paste tzupdater.jar into {{C:\Program Files\Atlassian\JIRA608\jre\bin>}}
* Run _DateTest.class_ and verify the time before the update
* Run tzupdater.jar
** Firstly check for update: {{java -jar tzupdater.jar -t}}
!tz-check.png|thumbnail!
** Then update: {{java -jar tzupdater.jar -u}}
* Run _DateTest.class_ and verify the time after the update
!datetest.png|thumbnail!
* Restart JIRA service. 
* Create an issue and compare it with the system's time. It differs by an hour. 
!tz-result.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected result
The time when issue created should be same with system time. 

h4. Workaround
Set JIRA timezone to *(GMT+02:00) Athens*
fields.summary: Timezone not updated
Drag and drop order for sub-tasks order
Ability to edit sub-task fields displayed on parent issues
Add 'Edit Permissions' to filter dropdown on left of issue nav

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA does not appear to be correctly creating issuekey hyperlinks (eg JRA-1234) with certain regex when it should be able to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new issue and comment on it with a link to another issue (so we can see hyperlink behaviour working). This can be done with the default project key pattern.
# Change the jira.projectkey.pattern to be the following:
{noformat}
[A-Z]+[0-9]*
{noformat}
# Reload the issue.

h3. Expected Results

The issue key hyperlinks correctly.

h3. Actual Results

It doesn't as per the attached example.

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by using a different regular expression, for example, {{([A-Z][A-Z]+)}} is the default. And to provide similar functionality for {{[A-Z]+[0-9]*}} (allow numbers), the following can be used:

{noformat}
([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Issue Key Hyperlinking is failing when using certain Regex in jira.projectkey.pattern
Remove screen-blur effect when clicking the button

fields.description:
# Open an issue that contains a date field that's not visible (because it has no value) *and* contains validation (e.g. a Date field)
# Press {{.}} and search for the field by name and open the edit field dialog.
# Type an invalid value and submit it.
A validation error is shown, but the user can not open the date picker again.

This only happens in Edit Field Dialog. A workaround is setting the value in the Edit Issue dialog.
fields.summary: Edit value custom field does not enable date picker after validation errors
Allow configureable timeouts for webhooks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34885].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*:

- Use the Contact Administrators {{JIRA-BASE-URL/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa}} to send a notification to JIRA Administrators.
- Send the mail.

*Actual behaviour:*

- The mail that the administrators receives is plain text and contains only only:
{noformat}
templates/email/html/contactadministrator.vm
{noformat}

!Screen Shot 2013-09-17 at 5.25.49 PM.png!

*Expected behaviour:*

- The message in the form should be delivered to the administrator.

*Workaround:*

You can reply to the mail and ask for details as the mail sender is preserved.
fields.summary: Contact the Administrators not working

fields.description: When trying to start the tomcat service for JIRA v3.8, I am getting this error message.
fields.summary: Jira says JAVA_HOME contains spaces even if it doesn't

fields.description:
after installing JIRA 6.0 from the Linux installer, I attempted to run config.sh, which failed with this message:
No JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME environment variable is set - attempting to just run java command
fields.summary: config.sh fails with error no JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME set
Allow project administrators to configure more project settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34881].
  {panel}

According to the documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Global+Permissions#ManagingGlobalPermissions-About'JIRASystemAdministrators'and'JIRAAdministrators'], only JIRA System Administrators are allowed to configure Application Links . 

But from the test, JIRA Administrators are able to add, remove and configure application link. 

However, only OAuth authentication can be created. 

*Steps to reproduce* 
* Create User A with JIRA System Administrators global permission.
* Create User B with JIRA Administration global permission.
* Login with User B and navigate to {{Administration >> Add-ons >> Application Links}}
* Create an application link.
fields.summary: JIRA Administrators can configure application link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34880].
  {panel}

h5.Steps to reproduce:

- Create a condition to a workflow step.
- Add a grouped condition.
- Now your grouped condition looks something like:

!condition.png!

- Try to switch the logic of the condition so that the inner condition be (any) and outer condition be (all), but you will notice you can't. Only the outer condition can be (any) and the inner will always be reset to (all), but iyou should be able to change it as per:

!condition2.png!
fields.summary: Unable to switch a grouped condition's logic (Workflow Editing)

fields.description:
Here is the step to reproduce: 
# set the windows resolution to 1366 x 768.
# Open the issue navigator with the detail view.
# Zoom in to 125% then zoom back to 100% 
# As consequence, neither the JIRA header menu not the lift barre on the right is appear on the screen.
!Screen Shot 2013-09-17 at 2.00.14 PM.png!

It seems the CSS front was picking up a wrong resolution, that Issue persist even refresh the screen. 

*As a workaround solution:* Clear the browser cache then close and reopen the issue navigator page.
fields.summary: JIRA menu out of screen on IE 9 after zoom in/out on issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34878].
  {panel}

Actually, when using advanced search, fields like for example the resolution, are not showing the translated values.

For example the resolution "Duplicate" translated to "Duplikat" in german.
in JQL I would have to write:
resolution = Duplicate

instead of:
resolution = Duplikat

Some users do never see the original, english version of the resolution,
thus are having trouble to search for.
fields.summary: Use translations in advanced search

fields.description:
The horizontal bar for code macro has been missing in JIRA 6 despite the code block has long text of codes and it has been auto wrap up the text. However, the same content will give the scroll bar on noformat macro in JIRA 6 and code macro in JIRA 5.2.x. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce'

# In JIRA 6 description field or comment field, insert the content of [^sample_sourcecode.java] into the code macro:
{noformat}
{code}
//insert source code from sample_sourcecode.java
{code}
{noformat}
# Add the comment or save the description

h3. Expected Result:
A horizontal bar appear for the code macros and the content shouldn't been auto wrap in the macro.

h3. Actual Result:
The content of code macro has been wrapping automatically and no horizontal scroll bar for the macro.

h3. Note:

Do refer to the screenshots:

h3. JIRA 6 code macro behaviour:
!jira6_code_macro.png|thumbnail!

h3. JIRA 5.2.11 code macro behaviour:
!jira6_code_macro.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: horizontal scroll bar missing for code macro in JIRA 6
Ability to hide users of one project from users of another
Improve speed of the application header drop-down menus.
The OnDemand experience in general is slow

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an issue type bug
# Create a few sub-task from the bug issue type
# Then from the parent issue screen itself via Google Chrome, you can see that it doesn't render the icon at all (no matter what zoom level it is) [^1.jpg]

(i) However it is not reproducible in other browser such as Internet Explorer and Mozilla Firefox
fields.summary: subtask type icon is not being rendered properly when at parent issue screen in Google Chrome
Tasks that are in 'Reviewing' status are NOT included in the Version Workload Report

Starting a fresh copy of 6.0.8 does not trigger the "Create Project" dialog.
[~wseliga] reports his new instance coming up with the description field rendering as plain text as well, but that wasn't the case when I tried it.

fields.summary: Scandic "ä"-letter doesnt show up correctly in issue navigator
JIRA should fail gracefully on built-in filters/project tabs
Can't attach images to feedback collector on OnDemand

fields.description:
JIRA shouldn't use the elipsis if in an HTML special character.

Update: The workflow action in the "Workflows" dropdown in the View Issue Page seems to be double escaping the labels for the dropdown's items
fields.summary: JIRA is breaking up words on HTML special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34848].
  {panel}

I create many more screens in a roll than I would like. So this would make my life easier. And by "life easier", I mean I would save ONE click per screen creation.

When you click Screen > Add Screen and name it, it goes to the screen where you can select the fields to be displayed in this screen. 

After choosing the fields, I need to click Screen > Add Screen again. Would be better if I could just click an "Add Screen" from the configure screen screen.

This gets in your nervs when you already have a thousand screens and is creating another thousand. The time it takes to load the "Screen" page - with the screens list - is too damn -high- long.
fields.summary: Insert "Add Screen" button in the configure screen option

Seen when running JIRA locally (atlas-debug) and after having restored data a few times (not 100% reproducible).

Restore/re-index operation appears to continue and succeed.
fields.summary: ConcurrentModificationException upon restoring data and reindexing

fields.description:
I created a ticket in our Jira system that had text like this:

{code}
Test the {{--foo}} and {{--bar}} options
{code}

For some reason, it thinks that some of that text needed to be struck out! Here, let me have *this* Jira instance convert it to HTML:

bq. Test the {{--foo}} and {{--bar}} options.

See how "foo" is struck out and there is only one dash in front of "bar"? Those double-dashes inside monospaced tags should be literal double-dashes, with no strikeouts, IMHO.
fields.summary: Monospaced Code Should Ignore Double-dashes

fields.description: the wizard is missing Servier ID at step 2 of 4 during install of 32 bit JIRA exe for windows.  I eventually put in an incorrect key and got the error of such and then the Server ID appeared.
fields.summary: Server ID not available at step 2 of 4
Official support for MS SQL 12
Elaborate the 'Restricting the Visibility of Worklog on an Issue' docs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We just upgraded to v6.0.8#6109-sha1:57cf099 last week, and since then, I've had numerous complaints about a hover hint that won’t stay dismissed whenever a ticket is opened.
 
The hint has the text:
 
“Hint: Press , to jump to fields for editing
Show other keyboard shortcuts”
 
And appears at the top, in the middle of the screen. You can close it by clicking the x, but it comes right back every time a ticket page is opened.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open an issue and clear the popup.
# Go to the admin section.
# Go back to that issue.

h3. Expected Results

The popup doesn't appear.

h3. Actual Results

The popup comes back and doesn't want to vanish.

h3. Notes

There are some other ways to make the popup keep coming back. Reported by other customers:

{quote}
Looks like IE9 is just as susceptible. Here are my observations for IE9:
- If I browse an issue, close the popup, then go straight to another issue via the URL (i.e. jira/browse/XXXX-100) then the popup {color:green}*does not occur*{color}. I can access any issue this way without the pop-up re-appearing.
- If I then access a Project page i.e. *http://jira/browse/XXXX*, or the dashboard, the popup will reappear on the first issue I browse following accessing the project page or dashboard.

Under FF 23.0.1:
- Any issue I browse via direct URL / hyperlink has the pop-up.

Here's the kicker:
{color:blue}*IE9 / FF23.0.1: Any +CLOSED+ issue does NOT cause the hint to popup again.*{color}
{quote}

This appears to be caused due to an error with REST, as per the attached screenshot.

h4. Workarounds
Some users have found a workaround for this, though it involves some manipulation of the system.  Please ensure to *backup* your files/system before attempting:
* Replacing the bundled jar file:
** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34837?focusedCommentId=521237&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-521237
* Adding a snippet to the Announcement Banner:
** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34837?focusedCommentId=521252&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-521252
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut hint won't stay dismissed for all users

fields.description:
We upgrade our JIRA at the weekend and have a couple of issues using it in Chrome - the attachements open fine in firefox?

Old attachments (word pdf etc) pre upgrade can't be opened even though the icon file type shows correctly?

We also had the following gadget previously jira-timesheet-plugin:timesheet-gadget/gadget.xml and this is not working in any browser is this still supported?

Regards
Chris
fields.summary: JIRA upgrade issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We just upgraded to v6.0.8#6109-sha1:57cf099 last week, and since then, I've had numerous complaints about a hover hint that won’t stay dismissed whenever a ticket is opened.
 
The hint has the text:
 
“Hint: Press , to jump to fields for editing
Show other keyboard shortcuts”
 
And appears at the top, in the middle of the screen. You can close it by clicking the x, but it comes right back every time a ticket page is opened.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open an issue and clear the popup.
# Go to the admin section.
# Go back to that issue.

h3. Expected Results

The popup doesn't appear.

h3. Actual Results

The popup comes back and doesn't want to vanish.

h3. Notes

There are some other ways to make the popup keep coming back. Reported by other customers:

{quote}
Looks like IE9 is just as susceptible. Here are my observations for IE9:
- If I browse an issue, close the popup, then go straight to another issue via the URL (i.e. jira/browse/XXXX-100) then the popup {color:green}*does not occur*{color}. I can access any issue this way without the pop-up re-appearing.
- If I then access a Project page i.e. *http://jira/browse/XXXX*, or the dashboard, the popup will reappear on the first issue I browse following accessing the project page or dashboard.

Under FF 23.0.1:

Here's the kicker:
{color:blue}*IE9 / FF23.0.1: Any +CLOSED+ issue does NOT cause the hint to popup again.*{color}

fields.description:
Currently we have been trying both on our test system and on our Production system to create a full XML backup of JIRA data and have come across an error which does not allow the backup to finish. It mainly stops and say unable to backup to filename.zip. 
Having looked in the logs it looks like there is a 4GB limitations like you can see in the log:
2013-09-15 05:43:03,132 http-80-36 ERROR karl.wilson 331x4900012x1 x4eb8a 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/XmlBackup.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultExportService] Error during XML backup.
org.apache.commons.compress.archivers.zip.Zip64RequiredException: entities.xml's size exceeds the limit of 4GByte.

Could you please help to find a workaround as we may need to move our data from MS-SQL to Oracle.
Thanks,

Karl
fields.summary: JIRA Full backup to XML - ZIP 4GB limitation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to increase the bulk edit limit is not reflected in JIRA 6.0.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add {{jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count=2000}} to {{jira-config.properties}}.
# Restart JIRA.
# Verify it appears in the logs in startup, e.g.:
{noformat}
___ Application Properties _________________

     ...
     jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count              : 2000
{noformat}
# Restart JIRA and attempt to bulk edit.

h3. Expected Results

You can bulk edit 2,000 issues.

h3. Actual Results

You can only bulk edit 1,000 as in the attached screenshot.


h3. Workaround
Add the following line to the {{jira-config.properties}} file as per [How to edit the jira-config.properties file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+edit+the+jira-config.properties+file]:
{noformat}
jira.search.stable.max.results = 2000
{noformat}
fields.summary: jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count not working in JIRA 6.0
Issue navigator's detail view should have configurable information in the issue list
User custom fields should render as Frother Controls

The Navigator will report the filter as saved but it will not update the UI to indicate the state.

fields.summary: Clicking "Save" on issue navigator saves the JQL but does not change UI state.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34825].
  {panel}

Cannot switch to classic view mode permanently. Only as administrator I can view and edit workflow in classic mode.

How can I configure the classic view mode as default for all users?

Steps to Reproduce:
-   https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/workflows/ListWorkflows.jspa
- Next to any workflow, click view under operations
- Click the Diagram button
- Click the Enter classic mode link
- There is no way to retain these settings so that you are taken to Classic Mode when returning to this workflow.
fields.summary: Workflow > Enter Classic Mode Mode Does Not Persist

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34824].
  {panel}

Broken links:
https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorial/git-branches#!merge has two links rebasing, git status which don't seem to work anymore (404).

After requesting an evaluation licence of Bamboo I received a survey popup which had a small css issue, I've attached the screenshot where the Submit button over the last drop down list. I'm currently working with Chrome Version 29.0.1547.66 m.

Hope it helps!

fields.description:

We did not observe any speed downgrade for other online apps or services we are using. We are still at the same Internet connection.

Could you be so kind to check what is the problem? It is almost impossible to work.

BCMLogiv
fields.summary: After latest updates our JIRA on demand is working incredible slower
Project avatar still updates if you cancel the 'Edit Project' modal screen in Project Admin
I cant stand it any more - can we do a  count of projects on the project page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In this bug, a read timeout exception is thrown before the timeout has passed, as can be seen in the logs below:
{noformat}
2014-01-29 07:36:47,601 QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchronisation for directory [ 10000 ] starting
2014-01-29 07:36:57,975 QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] failed synchronisation complete for directory [ 10000 ] in [ 10374ms ]
2014-01-29 07:36:58,084 QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: org.springframework.ldap.CommunicationException: avengers-the-initiative.net:389; nested exception is javax.naming.CommunicationException: avengers-the-initiative.net:389 [Root exception is java.net.SocketTimeoutException: connect timed out]
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.pageSearchResults(SpringLDAPConnector.java:400)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.SpringLDAPConnector.searchEntitiesWithRequestControls(SpringLDAPConnector.java:435)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.MicrosoftActiveDirectory.findTombstonesSince(MicrosoftActiveDirectory.java:882)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.MicrosoftActiveDirectory.findUserTombstonesSince(MicrosoftActiveDirectory.java:824)
{noformat}
h3. Expected Behaviour

The LDAP connection does not timeout before the *Read Timeout (seconds)* is reached in the User Directory Configuration, for example [Connecting to an LDAP Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory#ConnectingtoanLDAPDirectory-ServerSettings].
h3. Actual Behaviour

The connection times out before the *Read Timeout (seconds)* interval is met.
h3. Verification

Review when the synchronisation started in the logs, for example in the below snippet it's {{07:36:47,601}}:
{noformat}
2014-01-29 07:36:47,601 QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 INFO ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchronisation for directory [ 10000 ] starting
{noformat}
And compare that to when the timeout occurs:
{noformat}
2014-01-29 07:36:58,084 QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException: org.springframework.ldap.CommunicationException: avengers-the-initiative.net:389; nested exception is javax.naming.CommunicationException: avengers-the-initiative.net:389 [Root exception is java.net.SocketTimeoutException: connect timed out]
{noformat}
Here we can see the timeout occurred at {{07:36:58,084}} which is around 11 seconds, and the *Read Timeout (seconds)* was set to 60. It's highly likely this is a result of the Java bug. If the timeout occurs after the interval, this is normal and expected behaviour. For example if the timeout occurred at {{07:37:47,684}} this would be expected behaviour.
h3. Cause

This bug is triggered randomly in some environments, when the Read Timeout field in LDAP directory properties has been set to non-zero value.

This bug is caused by a known [bug (#6968459)|http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6968459] affecting Java SE.
h3. Workaround

Normally these exceptions can be safely ignored as the synchronisation is self-correcting. That is, problems encountered in one synchronisation round will get fixed in the following synchronisation round.

If the synchronisation fails to complete successfully repeatedly, a known workaround is to disable read timeout by setting the Read Timeout field in LDAP directory properties to 0. A side-effect of this change is that Crowd will not be able to recover automatically from LDAP requests that take too long to run, which might cause Crowd to stop communicating with LDAP directories until it is restarted.
h4. For JIRA 6.3.x customers

If you have confirmed that you are experiencing the aforementioned Java bug, we have developed a temporary fix until Oracle fixes the issue in the JDK itself.

This is in the form of 2 JARs, a [new version of Crowd for JIRA|https://maven.atlassian.com/service/local/repositories/atlassian-public/content/com/atlassian/crowd/crowd-ldap/2.8.0-OD-6-JIRA-06/crowd-ldap-2.8.0-OD-6-JIRA-06.jar] and a [patched+shaded version of the JDK's LDAP JNDI provider|https://maven.atlassian.com/3rdparty/shaded/atlassian/com/sun/jndi/ldap/atlassian-ldap-jndi-provider/1.8.1-atlassian/atlassian-ldap-jndi-provider-1.8.1-atlassian.jar].

Source for the patched+shaded version of the JDK's LDAP JNDI provider is available at [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-ldap-jndi-provider]

To install these files and apply them as a workaround:
 - Stop yourJIRA instance
 - Navigate to JIRA's {{webapp/WEB-INF/lib}} directory.
 - Replace the existing `crowd-ldap-???.jar` with [crowd-ldap-2.8.0-OD-6-JIRA-06.jar|https://maven.atlassian.com/service/local/repositories/atlassian-public/content/com/atlassian/crowd/crowd-ldap/2.8.0-OD-6-JIRA-06/crowd-ldap-2.8.0-OD-6-JIRA-06.jar]
 - Add the [atlassian-ldap-jndi-provider-1.8.1-atlassian.jar|https://maven.atlassian.com/3rdparty/shaded/atlassian/com/sun/jndi/ldap/atlassian-ldap-jndi-provider/1.8.1-atlassian/atlassian-ldap-jndi-provider-1.8.1-atlassian.jar] file to this directory as well.
 - Start your JIRA instance.

*IMPORTANT*: This will only work if the you are running Java 8 and a version of JIRA that uses crowd-ldap-2.8.0-OD-6 or compatible (JIRA 6.3.x)
fields.summary: LDAP Synchronisation can fail unexpectedly due to mistiming in the "LDAP response read time out"

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1. Make an issue or open an existing issue (make sure to have editing rights).
2. Click the description to edit it.
3. Click "Preview".
4. Note that it closes the editor and accepts all changes, defeating the purpose of a preview button.
fields.summary: Preview button acts as submit when editing issue description.

fields.description:
There are currently some odd behaviours if the client-side system time is behind.

* To reproduce, modify system time on client
* create a new issue ticket
* Issue's activity tab will show the date/timestamp instead of the human readable "Few moments ago"
* In GreenHopper, columns will show "-1 days in column", instead of "0 days"

Although the above is to manually reproduce the problem, it can occur with NTP-adjusted systems where the time is a bit off.

The time data stored into the database is not affected, this is purely a display issue on the client side.
fields.summary: Time display inconsistent when client-side time is a few minutes behind
